result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JAY T CONN

records.addlTxt:
4:00 PM Defendant JAY T CONN not in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JAY T CONN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF63 & 2022CF132. Statement by Atty Kapelis, has no idea where the defendant is and knows that the defendant did have a hearing in FDL county. Court orders a warrant, stayed to the end of tomorrow 10/26.

Court adjourned at 4:01 PM.
Review hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

11:00 AM Defendant JAY T CONN in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JAY T CONN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Defendant to sign bond and complete processing before leaving today.

Court adjourned at 11:02 AM
Return date scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter to the def dated May 6, 2022 re: def needs to complete processing and sign bond
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:42 AM Defendant JAY T CONN in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis has no objection. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waive the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim May 31, 2022 at 10:45 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:43 AM.
